Event.Description: Shows the 7plus settings window.
Event.Name: Show settings window

Event.Description: Restarts 7plus.
Event.Name: Restart 7plus

Event.Description: Append selected files to clipboard, instead of replacing current files on clipboard. This event will copy ALL the files on the clipboard.
Event.Name: Append file(s) to clipboard

Event.Description: Append selected files to clipboard, instead of replacing current files on clipboard. This event will cut ALL the files on the clipboard.
Event.Name: Append file(s) to clipboard: Cut

Event.Description: Make backspace go upwards in file dialogs, like in the good ol' XP.
Event.Name: Make backspace go upwards

Event.Description: Open CMD in the directory of the active explorer/file dialog window.
Event.Name: Run CMD in current directory

Event.Description: Copy the names of the selected files to the clipboard.
Event.Name: Copy filenames to clipboard

Event.Description: Copy the paths of the selected files to the clipboard.
Event.Name: Copy full filepaths to clipboard

Event.Description: Append the names of the selected files to the clipboard.
Event.Name: Append filenames to clipboard

Event.Description: Append the paths of the selected files to the clipboard.
Event.Name: Append full filepaths to clipboard

Event.Description: Create a new text file in the directory of the currently active explorer/desktop/file dialog.
Event.Name: Create new textfile

Event.Description: Create a new folder in the directory of the currently active explorer/desktop/file dialog.
Event.Name: Create new folder

Event.Description: Run explorer on double click on empty desktop space in the most recent directory.
Event.Name: Run explorer

Event.Description: Make explorer go upwards on double click in empty filelist area.
Event.Name: Double click go upwards

Event.Description: Open selected image files in an image editor (Paint.NET by default).
Event.Name: Open image files in image editor

Event.Description: Open selected non-image files in a text editor (Notepad++ by default).
Event.Name: Open non-image files in text editor

Event.Description: Select files in the active explorer window by entering a part of the filename.
Event.Name: Select files

Event.Description: Close a window by middle clicking it's title bar.
Event.Name: Middle click on title: Close window under mouse

Event.Description: Activate notification windows, flashing windows in the taskbar, or toggle between the current and the previously active window. Very useful for quickly responding to chats and switching back. Capslock state can still be changed by pressing a modifier key like CONTROL together with CAPSLOCK.&n;&n;This event is disabled by default to avoid confusing new users.
Event.Name: Activate notification/flashing/previous window

Event.Description: Right click on the titlebar of a window to toggle its "Always on top" property. This is useful for keeping a window visible so that you can easily copy data from and to it.
Event.Name: Right click on titlebar: Toggle always on top

Event.Description: Help event for "Toggle always on top" event.
Event.Name: Toggle always on top -> Context menu active

Event.Description: Help event for "Toggle always on top" event.
Event.Name: Toggle always on top -> No context menu active

Event.Description: Help event for "Toggle always on top" event.
Event.Name: Toggle always on top -> context menu timeout

Event.Description: Removes "Always on top" window property when the window gets maximized. This is done so that you can still switch to other windows by activating them, instead of having to minimize the window which is always on top.
Event.Name: Remove always on top when window gets maximized

Event.Description: Right click on the close button of a window to kill its process.
Event.Name: Right click on close button: Force-close window

Event.Description: Kill the process of the active window.
Event.Name: Force-close active program

Event.Description: Maximize the window under the mouse.
Event.Name: Maximize window under mouse

Event.Description: Restore or minimize the window under the mouse.
Event.Name: Restore / Minimize window under mouse

Event.Description: Show the Accessor window, which can be used to access many things by keyboard. Be sure to check out the Accessor options!
Event.Name: Show Accessor

Event.Description: This event makes it possible to right click on files in inactive explorer windows.
Event.Name: Allow right-click on files in inactive window

Event.Description: Set the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window to the FastFolder path saved in Slot 0.
Event.Name: Open Fast Folders Slot 0

Event.Description: Set the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window to the FastFolder path saved in Slot 1.
Event.Name: Open Fast Folders Slot 1

Event.Description: Set the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window to the FastFolder path saved in Slot 2.
Event.Name: Open Fast Folders Slot 2

Event.Description: Set the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window to the FastFolder path saved in Slot 3.
Event.Name: Open Fast Folders Slot 3

Event.Description: Set the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window to the FastFolder path saved in Slot 4.
Event.Name: Open Fast Folders Slot 4

Event.Description: Set the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window to the FastFolder path saved in Slot 5.
Event.Name: Open Fast Folders Slot 5

Event.Description: Set the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window to the FastFolder path saved in Slot 6.
Event.Name: Open Fast Folders Slot 6

Event.Description: Set the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window to the FastFolder path saved in Slot 7.
Event.Name: Open Fast Folders Slot 7

Event.Description: Set the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window to the FastFolder path saved in Slot 8.
Event.Name: Open Fast Folders Slot 8

Event.Description: Set the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window to the FastFolder path saved in Slot 9.
Event.Name: Open Fast Folders Slot 9

Event.Description: Save the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window in FastFolders Slot 0.
Event.Name: Save Fast Folders Slot 0

Event.Description: Save the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window in FastFolders Slot 1.
Event.Name: Save Fast Folders Slot 1

Event.Description: Save the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window in FastFolders Slot 2.
Event.Name: Save Fast Folders Slot 2

Event.Description: Save the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window in FastFolders Slot 3.
Event.Name: Save Fast Folders Slot 3

Event.Description: Save the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window in FastFolders Slot 4.
Event.Name: Save Fast Folders Slot 4

Event.Description: Save the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window in FastFolders Slot 5.
Event.Name: Save Fast Folders Slot 5

Event.Description: Save the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window in FastFolders Slot 6.
Event.Name: Save Fast Folders Slot 6

Event.Description: Save the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window in FastFolders Slot 7.
Event.Name: Save Fast Folders Slot 7

Event.Description: Save the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window in FastFolders Slot 8.
Event.Name: Save Fast Folders Slot 8

Event.Description: Save the path of the currently active explorer/file dialog window in FastFolders Slot 9.
Event.Name: Save Fast Folders Slot 9

Event.Description: Clear the path stored in FastFolders slot 0.
Event.Name: Clear Fast Folders Slot 0

Event.Description: Clear the path stored in FastFolders slot 1.
Event.Name: Clear Fast Folders Slot 1

Event.Description: Clear the path stored in FastFolders slot 2.
Event.Name: Clear Fast Folders Slot 2

Event.Description: Clear the path stored in FastFolders slot 3.
Event.Name: Clear Fast Folders Slot 3

Event.Description: Clear the path stored in FastFolders slot 4.
Event.Name: Clear Fast Folders Slot 4

Event.Description: Clear the path stored in FastFolders slot 5.
Event.Name: Clear Fast Folders Slot 5

Event.Description: Clear the path stored in FastFolders slot 6.
Event.Name: Clear Fast Folders Slot 6

Event.Description: Clear the path stored in FastFolders slot 7.
Event.Name: Clear Fast Folders Slot 7

Event.Description: Clear the path stored in FastFolders slot 8.
Event.Name: Clear Fast Folders Slot 8

Event.Description: Clear the path stored in FastFolders slot 9.
Event.Name: Clear Fast Folders Slot 9

Event.Description: Uploads the file(s) selected in the currently active explorer window/file dialog to the FTP server defined in FTP profile 1. Make sure to enter FTP login data for FTP profile 1.
Event.Name: Upload selected files

Event.Description: Show the clipboard manager menu, which is used to paste the most recent 10 clipboard text entries. You can also use the Numpad keys to select an entry.
Event.Name: Clipboard Manager

Event.Description: Open CMD in C:\ when no useful directory can be extracted from the current context.
Event.Name: Run CMD

Event.Description: Open CMD with the path extracted from the title of the active window.
Event.Name: Run CMD with path from window title

Event.Description: Make it possible to close CMD with ALT+F4.
Event.Name: Close CMD with ALT + F4

Event.Description: Make it possible to paste text in CMD by pressing CTRL+V.
Event.Name: CMD: CTRL+V to paste from clipboard

Event.Description: Open Task Manager when an empty part of the taskbar is double-clicked.
Event.Name: Run task manager

Event.Description: Increase the sound volume with the mouse wheel over the taskbar.
Event.Name: Over taskbar: Increase volume

Event.Description: Decrease the sound volume with the mouse wheel over the taskbar.
Event.Name: Over taskbar: Decrease volume

Event.Description: Rotate images with R in windows picture viewer.
Event.Name: Picture viewer: Rotate image right with R

Event.Description: Rotate images with L in windows picture viewer.
Event.Name: Picture viewer: Rotate image left with L

Event.Description: Upload the selected files to the FTP server defined in FTP profile 1 by clicking on the "Upload" button in explorer. Make sure to enter FTP login data for FTP profile 1. If you notice problems with these kind of buttons you can remove them on the Fast Folders page. They will be readded when you press OK or Apply though.
Event.Name: Upload selected files

Event.Description: Create a new text file by clicking on the "New text file" button in explorer.If you notice problems with these kind of buttons you can remove them on the Fast Folders page. They will be readded when you press OK or Apply though.
Event.Name: New text file

Event.Description: Restores the previous file selection. This is very useful if you need to select many files and accidently click somewhere wrong. This event only works if the last option on the Misc page is disabled.
Event.Name: Restore selection

Event.Description: Toggles the "Show hidden files" explorer setting.
Event.Name: Toggle hidden files

Event.Description: Move the window under the mouse to the bottom of the window stack.
Event.Name: Move window to bottom

Event.Description: Open CMD in desktop directory when desktop window is active.
Event.Name: Run CMD in desktop directory

Action.Text: Enter parameters. Paths might need`n to be enclosed in double quotes.
Action.Title: Enter Parameters

Event.Description: This event adds a context menu option for executable files and asks for parameters and runs the selected file with them. It requires that the context menu shell extension is properly installed, which is normally the case. If this option does not show up, edit this event and click on "Register context menu shell extension".
Event.Name: Run with parameters

Trigger.Description: Runs an executable file with parameters
Trigger.Name: Run with parameters...

Event.Description: This event adds a menu option in the context menu of image files that opens a dialog for batch image conversion. It requires that the context menu shell extension is properly installed, which is normally the case. If this option does not show up, edit this event and click on "Register context menu shell extension".
Event.Name: Batch image converter

Trigger.Description: Opens a dialog for batch image conversion.
Trigger.Name: Convert Images

Event.Description: This event adds a context menu option for files that opens a dialog that displays MD5 checksums of the selected files. It requires that the context menu shell extension is properly installed, which is normally the case. If this option does not show up, edit this event and click on "Register context menu shell extension".
Event.Name: MD5 Checksums

Trigger.Description: Opens a dialog that displays MD5 checksums of the selected files.
Trigger.Name: MD5 Checksum(s)

Event.Description: This event adds a context menu option for files and folders that uploads the selected files/folders to an FTP server. It requires that the context menu shell extension is properly installed, which is normally the case. If this option does not show up, edit this event and click on "Register context menu shell extension".
Event.Name: Context Menu Upload

Trigger.Description: Uploads the selected files to an FTP server
Trigger.Name: Upload

Event.Description: This event adds a context menu option that appears in the background menu of directories. It toggles the visibility of hidden files. It requires that the context menu shell extension is properly installed, which is normally the case. If this option does not show up, edit this event and click on "Register context menu shell extension".
Event.Name: Toggle Hidden Files

Trigger.Description: Toggles the visibility of hidden files
Trigger.Name: Toggle hidden files

Event.Description: Shows the volume notification window when the Mute button is pressed.
Event.Name: Show volume notification window

Event.Description: Shows the volume notification window when Volume Down is pressed.
Event.Name: Show volume notification window

Event.Description: Shows the volume notification window when Volume Up is pressed.
Event.Name: Show volume notification window

Event.Description: This event starts a dynamic timer when the "Start timer" menu entry from the 7plus tray menu is selected.
Event.Name: Dynamic Timer: tray menu item

Action.Text: What type of timer would you like to start?
Action.Title: Dynamic timer

Event.Description: This event asks for the type of timer that shall be started and its time and then starts the appropriate event that configures and starts the matching timer.
Event.Name: Dynamic timer: Main

Event.Description: This timer is triggered with a dynamic time set by an input action.
Event.Name: Dynamic Timer: Message timer

Event.Description: This event asks for a message and starts the message timer.
Event.Name: Dynamic Timer: Ask for message and start message timer

Event.Description: This event asks for the program to be launched and starts the Run program timer
Event.Name: Dynamic Timer: Ask for program and start Run program timer

Event.Description: This timer runs the program selected by the user.
Event.Name: Dynamic Timer: Run program timer

Event.Description: This timer shuts down the computer after the specified time.
Event.Name: Dynamic Timer: Shutdown timer

Event.Description: This event starts the Shutdown timer.
Event.Name: Dynamic Timer: Start shutdown timer

Event.Description: This event starts a dynamic timer when the taskbar clock is clicked with the middle mouse button.
Event.Name: Dynamic Timer: Middle mouse click over clock

Event.Description: This event will write a newline sequence to the focused control and thus start a new line. This is useful in text fields where pressing Enter would press a button.
Event.Name: Write newline characters

Event.Description: This event shows the contents of all selected folders in a flat view.
Event.Name: Show flat view of selected files

Action.Type: Open folder in new window / tab

Event.Description: Opens the explorer folder under the mouse in a new window or tab.
Event.Name: Open folder in new window/tab

Event.Description: Closes the window belonging to the taskbar button under the mouse or toggles the mute state when over empty space
Event.Name: On Taskbar: Close window or toggle mute

Event.Description: Toggles the wallpaper using the list of wallpapers defined in Windows (7 or later). Same as the desktop context menu option.
Event.Name: Toggle Wallpaper (Mouse over desktop)

Event.Description: Closes the explorer tab under the mouse.
Event.Name: Close explorer tab under mouse

Event.Description: This event shows the Explorer Rename/Replace dialog which is used to replace text in filenames and files.
Event.Name: Show Explorer Rename/Replace dialog

Event.Description: This event adds a context menu for directories that shows them in a flat view. It requires that the context menu shell extension is properly installed, which is normally the case. If this option does not show up, edit this event and click on "Register context menu shell extension".
Event.Name: Flat View in directory menus

Trigger.Description: Shows the contents of the selected folders in a flat view.
Trigger.Name: Flat View

Event.Description: This event shows the Aero Flip 3D Task switching dialog (or the standard task switcher dialog if unavailable) when the mouse is moved to the top left corner of the screen.
Event.Name: Show Aero Flip 3D

Event.Description: This event will shorten an URL in the clipboard by using the goo.gl service. The URL in clipboard will be replaced with the shortened version.
Event.Name: URL shortener

Event.Description: This event will merge all explorer windows into a single explorer window with tabs.
Event.Name: Merge all explorer windows

Event.Description: This event allows to drag the window under the cursor by holding ALT + Left mouse button. Alt+Left click is still possible. Explorer and dialog windows are handled in another event.
Event.Name: Mouse Window Drag

Event.Description: This event allows to drag the explorer/dialog window under the mouse.
Event.Name: Mouse Window Drag

Event.Description: This event resizes the explorer/dialog window under the cursor while holding ALT+Right mouse button.
Event.Name: Mouse Window Resize

Event.Description: This event resizes the window under the cursor while holding ALT + Right mouse button while still allowing ALT+Right clicks. Explorer and dialog windows are handled in another event.
Event.Name: Mouse Window Resize

Event.Description: This event inverts the explorer file selection.
Event.Name: Invert selection

Event.Description: This event shows the explorer batch rename/replace dialog with "Replace in Files" preselected.
Event.Name: Explorer Replace in Files Dialog

Event.Description: This event adds a context menu entry for batch-replacing parts of the filenames of the selected files. It requires that the context menu shell extension is properly installed, which is normally the case. If this option does not show up, edit this event and click on "Register context menu shell extension".
Event.Name: Replace in filenames

Trigger.Description: Opens the batch rename/replace dialog to replace parts of the filenames of the selected files.
Trigger.Name: Replace in filenames

Event.Description: This event adds a context menu entry for replacing text in the selected files. It requires that the context menu shell extension is properly installed, which is normally the case. If this option does not show up, edit this event and click on "Register context menu shell extension".
Event.Name: Replace in files

Trigger.Description: Opens the batch rename/replace dialog to batch-replace text in the selected files.
Trigger.Name: Replace in file contents

Action.Text: Enter a filename for the screenshot (without extension)
Action.Title: Enter filename

Event.Description: This event takes a screenshot and shows it in image converter for further processing.
Event.Name: Take screenshot: Use Image Converter

Action.Text: Enter a filename for the screenshot (without extension)
Action.Title: Enter filename

Event.Description: This event takes a screenshot of an area that can be selected by the user and shows it in image converter for further processing.
Event.Name: Take screenshot of custom area: Use Image Converter

Action.Text: Enter a filename for the screenshot (without extension)
Action.Title: Enter filename

Event.Description: This event takes a screenshot of the active window and shows it in image converter for further processing.
Event.Name: Take screenshot of window: Use Image Converter

Action.Type: Move Slide Window out of screen

Event.Description: This event slides a window out of the left side of the screen. Also take a look at the Slide Window settings.
Event.Name: Slide Window left

Action.Type: Move Slide Window out of screen

Event.Description: This event slides a window out of the right side of the screen. Also take a look at the Slide Window settings.
Event.Name: Slide Window right

Action.Type: Move Slide Window out of screen

Event.Description: This event slides a window out of the top side of the screen. Also take a look at the Slide Window settings.
Event.Name: Slide Window up

Action.Type: Move Slide Window out of screen

Event.Description: This event slides a window out of the bottom side of the screen. Also take a look at the Slide Window settings.&n;&n;NOTE: This event usually does nothing as the taskbar is at the bottom of the screen on most systems.
Event.Name: Slide window down

Event.Description: This action toggles the always on top property of the active window.
Event.Name: Toggle always on top of active window

Event.Description: This event allows to paste an AutoHotkey script in a dialog and runs it afterwards. This event requires that you have installed an AutoHotkey interpreter and assigned it to the .ahk file extension. The script file is deleted when 7plus exits. This event can be used as a template for other scripting languages.
Event.Name: Run temporary AHK script

Event.Description: This event sends an opening bracket character when NumpadEnd is pressed (Numpad1 with NumLock OFF). This remapping is used to enter equations into scientific calculators using only the numpad.
Event.Name: NumpadEnd -> '('

Event.Description: This event sends a closing bracket character when NumpadPgDn is pressed (Numpad3 with NumLock OFF). This remapping is used to enter equations into scientific calculators using only the numpad.
Event.Name: NumpadPgDn -> ')'

Event.Description: This event sends a '^' character when NumpadHome is pressed (Numpad7 with NumLock OFF). This remapping is used to enter equations into scientific calculators using only the numpad.
Event.Name: NumpadHome -> '^'

Event.Description: This event sends a sqrt( string when NumpadPgUp is pressed Numpad9 with NumLock OFF). This remapping is used to enter equations into scientific calculators using only the numpad.
Event.Name: NumpadPgUp -> "sqrt("

Event.Description: This event sends a '=' character when NumpadIns is pressed (Numpad0 with NumLock OFF). This remapping is used to enter equations into scientific calculators using only the numpad.
Event.Name: NumpadIns -> '='

Event.Description: This event runs a Google search for the selected text.
Event.Name: Search selected text with Google

Event.Description: This event provides a Shutdown command for the Accessor launcher.
Event.Name: Accessor: Shutdown

Event.Description: This event provides a Hibernate command for the Accessor launcher.
Event.Name: Accessor: Hibernate

Event.Description: This event provides a Standby command for the Accessor launcher.
Event.Name: Accessor: Standby

Event.Description: This event provides a Reboot command for the Accessor launcher.
Event.Name: Accessor: Reboot

Event.Description: This event provides a Log Off command for the Accessor launcher.
Event.Name: Accessor: Log Off

Event.Description: This event provides a command for the Accessor launcher to lock the computer.
Event.Name: Accessor: Lock workstation

Event.Description: This event makes it possible to quickly use Accessor in explorer or file dialog windows to select a file from the current directory and run it.
Event.Name: Open Accessor to execute files from the current directory

Event.Description: This hotkey opens Accessor in a mode that can be used to open the selected file with a program other than the default file association. It's like Open With dialog, just faster!
Event.Name: Use Accessor to open the selected file with a program

Event.Description: This event provides a command for the Accessor launcher to lock the computer.
Event.Name: Accessor: Lock workstation

Event.Description: This event replaces the default ALT + TAB dialog with the window switcher plugin of Accessor.&n;&n;This event is disabled by default to avoid confusing new users.
Event.Name: Replace ALT + TAB dialog with Accessor

Event.Description: This event creates the possibility to use voice output with Accessor by typing "say text".
Event.Name: Accessor: Voice output

Action.Type: Trigger an "If this then that" recipe

Event.Description: Post a tweet from within the Accessor by writing "tweet Text". This event works in conjunction with the If this then that integration so it requires an account at this web service and you need to enter the login details of the email address you use for it here. Additionally, you need to use this recipe.
Event.Name: Accessor & IFTTT: Post a tweet

Event.Description: This event executes the program/file/folder defined in the first slot in the Accessor window.
Event.Name: Execute Accessor Program Button 1

Event.Description: This event executes the program/file/folder defined in the second slot in the Accessor window.
Event.Name: Execute Accessor Program Button 2

Event.Description: This event executes the program/file/folder defined in the third slot in the Accessor window.
Event.Name: Execute Accessor Program Button 3

Event.Description: This event executes the program/file/folder defined in the 4th slot in the Accessor window.
Event.Name: Execute Accessor Program Button 4

Event.Description: This event executes the program/file/folder defined in the 5th slot in the Accessor window.
Event.Name: Execute Accessor Program Button 5

Event.Description: This event executes the program/file/folder defined in the 6th slot in the Accessor window.
Event.Name: Execute Accessor Program Button 6

Event.Description: This event executes the program/file/folder defined in the 7th slot in the Accessor window.
Event.Name: Execute Accessor Program Button 7

Event.Description: This event executes the program/file/folder defined in the 8th slot in the Accessor window.
Event.Name: Execute Accessor Program Button 8

Event.Description: This event executes the program/file/folder defined in the 9th slot in the Accessor window.
Event.Name: Execute Accessor Program Button 9

Event.Description: This event executes the program/file/folder defined in the 10th slot in the Accessor window.
Event.Name: Execute Accessor Program Button 10

Event.Description: This event executes the program/file/folder defined in the 11th slot in the Accessor window.
Event.Name: Execute Accessor Program Button 11

Event.Description: This event executes the program/file/folder defined in the 12th slot in the Accessor window.
Event.Name: Execute Accessor Program Button 12

Event.Description: This event executes the program/file/folder defined in the 13th slot in the Accessor window.
Event.Name: Execute Accessor Program Button 13

Event.Description: This event executes the program/file/folder defined in the 14th slot in the Accessor window.
Event.Name: Execute Accessor Program Button 14

Event.Description: This event executes the program/file/folder defined in the 15th slot in the Accessor window.
Event.Name: Execute Accessor Program Button 15

Event.Description: This event executes the program/file/folder defined in the 16th slot in the Accessor window.
Event.Name: Execute Accessor Program Button 16

Event.Description: This event executes the program/file/folder defined in the 17th slot in the Accessor window.
Event.Name: Execute Accessor Program Button 17

Event.Description: This event executes the program/file/folder defined in the 18th slot in the Accessor window.
Event.Name: Execute Accessor Program Button 18
